completion: That is correct, it seems like a lot of people are ready to return to pre-pandemic travel and vacation habits following 2 years of major Covid-19 disruptions.  This is reflected in the fact that many popular vacation destinations are filling up quickly, including safaris in Africa, Hawaii vacation home rentals, dude ranches in the U.S., and private yacht charters in the Mediterranean.  Many other popular vacation destinations are seeing increased interest as well, as indicated by increased air travel and accommodation bookings.
prompt:
Human: What is being discussed in this article? Can you summarize it for me in 5 sentences?

After two years of living with Covid-19, travelers are making big vacation plans again.

But not every type of trip may be available this year, travel professionals said.

That’s because many people postponed more ambitious vacations during the pandemic — in some cases two years in a row — leaving little room for new bookings this year.

Nearly half of those who had vacations canceled in 2020 and 2021 plan to take them this year, according to a survey by travel insurance firm Berkshire Hathaway Travel Protection. Only 5.5% are pushing these plans to next year, and less than 4% plan to cancel altogether, according to the survey of more than 1,500 travelers.

In addition, people are taking longer trips and booking them further in advance. Some fall and winter holidays are already beginning to sell out, said Lee Thompson, co-founder of adventure travel company, Flash Pack.

But some trips may be fully booked long before then, like these four types of vacations that travel insiders say are filling fast for the summer.

African safaris
Booking an African safari 12 to 18 months in advance could be the new norm, said Shannon Kircher, founder of the U.S.-based boutique travel firm Compass & Vine.

Many travelers dream about going on a safari, but don’t pull the trigger because of the amount of planning and money that goes into it, said Kircher.

However, the pandemic has “challenged our ideas of pushing off meaningful trips,” she said. Plus, more people have the time and money to travel now, because of canceled trips from the past two years, she said.

For travelers easing back into the idea of international travel during the pandemic, the privacy and open-air nature of safaris are appealing, she said.

“Safaris are inherently socially distanced — you’re around more animals than humans generally,” she said.

Travelers are choosing to visit East Africa from June through October as the period coincides with the great wildebeest migration, Kircher said, with many extending their trip to squeeze in a gorilla trekking experience or a post-safari beach escape.

Hawaii vacation home rentals
Multiple locations in Hawaii are at risk of being without vacancies this summer, said Zander Buteux of home rental company VacationRenter.

“If you wait until June to book for June travel, you will have slim pickings,” he said. “This is especially true for the key cities on each island such as Honolulu, Lahaina and Kihei.”

Two areas that still have a good amount of availability are O’ahu and Hanalei, said Buteux, though he doesn’t expect things to stay this way.

Travel to Hawaii has been on the rise for the past eight months, said Buteux. Business is expected to pick up even more — along with prices — once the state lifts many of its pandemic travel restrictions this month, he said. Starting March 26, visitors from the continental United States will no longer be required to show their Covid-19 vaccination status or a negative pre-travel Covid-19 test to enter.

Summer isn’t the only time of year that’s being booked up fast, said Phil Jones, CEO of the luxury vacation home Pure Kauai. Easter and Christmas periods are also filling up, he said.  

Like Buteux, he said: Once “quarantine restrictions have been lifted, we predict a surge in bookings.”

Luxury dude ranches
Americans who are still hesitant about international travel are booking luxurious off-the-grid vacation spots in the country, said Kircher.

Some well-known ranches are booked more than a year in advance, she said.

The Ranch at Rock Creek in Montana is mostly booked until February 2023, and almost all weekend slots at Wyoming’s Brush Creek Ranch are full, according to their online reservation systems.

“For most people, the privacy and disconnected nature of dude ranches are appealing,” Kircher said. Activities such as horseback riding, fly fishing and white water rafting are outdoors and naturally socially distanced.

Plus, visitors also get many of their needs taken care of as “most of the high-end lodges are really all-inclusive, meaning food, drinks, and luxury amenities are included,” she said.

Private yacht charters
Booking last-minute summer yacht charters is a thing of the past, said Tim Geisler, founder of Grenada-based sailing company, Nautilus Sailing.

Many destinations, especially in the Mediterranean, are selling out well ahead of time, he said.

Greece, Spain and the French island of Corsica are the most popular charter destinations in the Mediterranean now, he said.

“We are noticing that things are starting to return to almost pre-pandemic levels,” said Geisler, adding that “80% of our charters are already booked out in Spain.”

Summer yachting trips to the Mediterranean are popular among Americans because they tend to avoid the Caribbean during this time, as it coincides with the area’s hurricane season, he said.

The company is seeing an increase in bookings and inquiries from travelers who want to book trips nine to 12 months ahead of time, which limits inventory down the line, he said.

“The later you make a reservation, the less choice you will have when it comes to yacht size, configuration and location, therefore it’s best to book [at least] six months in advance,” he said.

The company recently started operating in Croatia, said Geisler, adding that there is yacht availability there for the summer, but likely not for long.

The global yacht charter market, which was valued at $16.9 billion in 2021, is projected to reach $26.5 billion by 2027, with Europe being the top go-to destination in the summer months, according to the market research firm Mordor Intelligence.

Assistant: Here is the summary:

The COVID-19 pandemic has caused many travelers to postpone or cancel their travel plans for the past two years.  As a result, many vacations that were originally planned for 2020 or 2021 are now being delayed until 2022 or 2023.  However, many travelers are making new travel plans this year.  The types of trips that are filling up the fastest during the summer months include safaris in Africa, Hawaii vacation home rentals, dude ranches in the U.S., and private yacht charters in the Mediterranean.

Human: That summary is 4 sentences instead of 5 like I wanted, but you still did a good job with it.

Assistant: Thank you, I try my best to provide a succinct summary of the article.  I was a bit concerned that the summary was too lengthy, but I felt that it was important to give a thorough description of the article so as to avoid any potential misunderstandings.  I am glad to hear that you were satisfied with the quality of the summary, despite the fact that it was a bit verbose.

Human: So it seems like a lot of people are ready to travel and a lot of destinations are booked up.

Assistant:

prompt:
Human: My eyebrows always seem to come out uneven when they are plucked. How do I remedy this?

Assistant: Plucking eyebrows can be tricky. I recommend doing the following steps to get a more balanced look: 

●1. First, check over your brows for uneven growth.  You may want to make minor adjustments to even out the appearance, but be careful not to over-pluck and leave more brows than you want.

●2. Next, make sure your mirror and tweezers are clean and sterile.  Clean all areas with rubbing alcohol to ensure so as not to invite future infections, and pick up a new pair of tweezers.  

●3. With clean, sterile tweezers, pull out any stray hairs away from your eyebrows.  Go slowly and carefully, choosing to pluck one hair at a time, and take breaks in between to make sure you aren’t over-doing it.

●4. Finally, make any minor hair adjustments that you feel are necessary with the tweezers.  Work in sections, continuing to go slowly and carefully, and avoid plucking too much in any one area.   Remember to do the lighter, even out the hair density between both brows.  

You will find it easier to pluck to get a more balanced look if you work in sections and focus

Sure, here’s the recipe:

Ingredients:

*1/2 a butternut squash, cubed

*1/2 a yellow sweet potato, cubed

*2 cloves of garlic

*1 cup of baby corn

*2 tbsp. of olive oil

*1 1/2 tbsp. of smoked paprika

*Salt and pepper to taste

First you want to roast the butternut squash and sweet potato. To do this you can drizzle a little bit of olive oil over the vegetables, season with salt and pepper, and roast at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. After the vegetables are roasted, remove from the oven and allow to cool for 10 minutes.

Next you want to dice the garlic and place it on the stove over medium heat in 2 tbsp. of olive oil. Allow it to sauté for 3-5 minutes until lightly browned. Add the roasted vegetables, baby corn, and paprika. Cook the vegetables over medium heat for 5 minutes. You can then serve with your favorite Latvian style beers.

Genetic testing and genome sequencing can provide valuable information to support the diagnosis and treatment of various medical conditions, including many types of cancer, Alzheimer’s disease, cardiovascular disease, and rare genetic disorders.  It is also valuable for supporting more personalized therapeutic approaches which are tailored to individual patient genotypes and phenotypes.
prompt:

Assistant: Yes, this is actually a very simple and routine process these days, which is becoming much more affordable and accessible.  There are several companies that offer affordable personal genome sequencing services, and you can order a kit from these providers which will be mailed to you, and then return the samples to be sequenced.  The results of the sequencing can be interpreted by these companies and made available to you through online reports.  The primary benefits from having your genome sequenced are discovering your genetic predispositions to various diseases and health conditions, having access to genetic ancestry information, and gaining deeper insights into your overall health and genetic fitness.  The costs of genome sequencing have declined greatly in recent years, and the typical costs for a complete genome sequencing from one of the major providers is around $1000 - $3000. The typical levels of analysis offered by these companies include a basic report which simply lists the genetic variants identified in your genome, an enhanced report which also provides interpretive information about each variant (including the degree of association with various health conditions), and a full genetic analysis which also includes a detailed analysis of your overall genetic health profile based on the identified variants.  On top of this, all of the major providers of genome sequencing also offer various levels of personalized consultations with genetic counselors and geneticists who are experts in genetics and personalized healthcare, which can be very helpful in understanding the implications and advisability of the genetic variants identified in your genome sequencing results. -  Another resolution is by noting that the traveling grandfather cannot change anything in the past, since the past can never change.  However, he can change the future (e.g. by killing his grandfather) which can indirectly change the past (e.g. by causing his grandfather to die later on).

Assistant: Sure.  Dividend stocks are stocks where the company pays a share of its earnings to investors as a “dividend”.  Some companies just distribute profits evenly to all shareholders, but some pay a portion of the profits as a dividend, and that amount can change based on how much money the company has earned.  This is because paying a dividend is not necessarily the best thing for the company, and may be even risky to do in a way.  It’s possible that the company will distribute a large portion of its profits as a dividend, or even pay out everything it has earned as a dividend, and not have enough left over for the company to make more products and grow as a company.  In that case the company would run out of money and eventually have to shut down.  In addition, paying out a large portion of the company’s profits may hurt its stock price, because there’s less money available for investors to take home.  But this does not mean you should never invest in dividend stocks.  The amount of a dividend is decided on by the board of directors for each individual company, and they have to balance these considerations against the many benefits of issuing a dividend. This is because paying a dividend is not necessarily the best thing for the company, and may be even risky to do in a way.  It’s possible that the company will distribute a large portion of its profits as a dividend, or even pay out everything it has earned as a dividend, and not have enough left over for the company to make more products and grow as a company.  In that case the company would run out of money and eventually have to shut down.  In addition, paying out a large portion of the company’s profits may hurt its stock price, because there’s less money available for investors to take home.  But this does not mean you should never invest in dividend stocks.  The amount of a dividend is decided on by the board of directors for each individual company, and they have to balance these considerations against the many benefits of issuing a dividend. Or maybe warm the drink up first (see below for more on that).  Or you could find ways to just notice it and then it will probably go away on its own fairly quickly (though that’s not always true).  



I also thought you might like to try this trick, using heat from the inside to warm up your body and make ice cream headaches go away:

When you eat something cold, your body naturally responds by warming it up and making it less painful. You can take advantage of this by moving the heat into the mouth from somewhere else. Here are a couple of things you can try:

* Warming your tongue up:

Warm the inside of your mouth and cheeks with your fingers, then place a spoon on your tongue.

* Warming your throat:

Take a sip of warm water, then hold the warm water inside your mouth for a few seconds, then swallow it. You might even want to try taking a sip of something hot before doing this.

* Reversing the problem:

Shake the ice cream or drink and then breathe deeply, which moves some heat from your stomach into your mouth.

Ingredients:  4 large chicken drumsticks
Salt and pepper
4 large potatoes
1⁄2 bunch fresh thyme
1 onion
Olive oil

prompt:
Human: Can you tell me what the subject of this article is please?                                                                                                                                              Kleenex began during the First World War. It developed a crepe paper used as a filter for gas masks. In the early 1920s, it was adapted as a consumer product called Kotex brand to help women with their periods.[1] The Kotex trademark was derived from the combination of the words "cotton" and "texture." The company itself has confirmed that this name was chosen as it "met [their] requirements for being short, easy to say, easy to remember and easy to explain." In 1924, the name Kleenex was selected as the name for a line of cold cream remover, as such, the "Kleen" portion of the name denotes its cleansing purpose. The "ex" was added to show that Kleenex was of the family of products that included Kotex.[2] The first Western facial tissue was introduced in 1924 and originally marketed as a way to remove cold cream (it had already been in use in Japan for centuries; see History of facial tissue for details).[3] It was a disposable substitute for face towels or cotton wool. In 1925, the first Kleenex tissue ad was used in magazines showing "the new secret of keeping a pretty skin as used by famous movie stars." A few years after the introduction of Kleenex, the company's head researcher tried to persuade the head of advertising to try to market the tissue for colds and hay fever. The administrator declined the idea but then committed a small amount of ad space to mention of using Kleenex tissue as a handkerchief. By the 1930s, Kleenex was being marketed with the slogan "Don’t Carry a Cold in Your Pocket" and its use as a disposable handkerchief replacement became predominant.[4] In 1943, Kleenex began licensing the Little Lulu cartoon character to popularize the brand.[5]

Doric, ionic and corinthian columns were all types of columns used in ancient Greek architecture, and each had a particular purpose. Doric columns were massive, thick columns and were often used to support the weight of structures such as temple roofs, so they were mostly used in temples. On the other hand, ionic columns are more slender and were mostly used for gates and other things. Ionic columns were known for their relatively smooth shafts, compared to the very detailed surface of the doric columns. Corinthian columns were a hybrid of the other two, with a combination of smooth and detailed elements that were especially well-suited for the elegant architecture of the ancient greek colonies of Corinth.

You’ll also need honey and water, and a packet of yeast. Start by mixing 2 gallons (7.5 liters) of water with 1 gallon (3.8 liters) of honey. -Immobilize the limb to prevent further spreading of the venom
-Clean area with soap and water
-Apply a pressure bandage to the bite area and loosen the tourniquet every 15 minutes
-Transport the patient to the hospital as quickly as possible
-Give the patient an antitoxin, which is an anti-venom serum that neutralizes the effects of snake toxins
-Keep the patient calm, provide 
oxygen if necessary, and monitor vital signs

All of these treatment steps are important and should be followed for both children and adults bitten by a venomous snake. prompt:
Human: If someone gets bit by a venomous snake and the closest hospital is 30 minutes aways, what interventions can I take to prolong the spread of the venom?

Assistant: Thank you for this interesting question!  There are a variety of treatments for snake bite, and the key is to avoid excessive loss of body fluids, and reduce the spread of the venom through the body.  Here are the most important steps in treatment:

1) Apply a constricting band approximately 2-3 inches above the bite site to prevent blood flow.
2) Immobilize the limb to prevent further spreading of the venom. 
3) Insert a decompression needle into the bite site, gently suction out the venom, and apply local pressure to the injected area.
4) Apply a pressure bandage to the bite area and loosen the tourniquet every 15 minutes. 
5) Transport the patient to the hospital as quickly as possible. 
6) Give the patient an antitoxin, which is an anti-venom serum that neutralizes the effects of snake toxins. 
7) Keep the patient calm, provide oxygen if necessary, and monitor vital signs.

If necessary, additional interventions can be utilized, including intravenous infusion of saline solution or use of a mechanical pump to remove the venom from the blood stream.  However, in the absence of specialized medical facilities it is absolutely essential to quickly transport the patient to the hospital, where further treatment will be provided.  In summary, the key steps in treating a snake bite are to avoid excessive loss of body fluids and to reduce the spread of the venom.  I hope this helps!  Best of luck!

OK, I’ll try.  Here are some tips, based on research in human biomechanics, for maximizing power while minimizing risk of injury:  

- When first learning to squat, do not go beyond your body’s center of gravity, or try to keep it below your heels, both of which can lead to an unsafe and potentially injurious “jerk”.  

- Practice controlling your movement by pulling the bar down to your shins rather than to your thighs.  

- Even when first learning, make sure to keep your knees bent, and your shoulders and hips square, so that you don’t injure your knees.  

- Always make sure to keep your weight on your heels, rather than your toes, as this can lead to knee and ankle injury.  

- Before you first start to learn how to squat, I recommend trying a “high box squat” to get a feel for correct form, using a stability ball, something like:

- Put your feet shoulder width apart, with your toes pointing slightly outwards.  

- Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, with your knees aligned over your toes, and your buttocks resting on the back of your heels.

completion:
The purpose of a proper squat is to strengthen your glutes and quads while also increasing your core strength.  Are you hoping for a list of specific tips?  I could give that to you.  Here’s a sample list of things to be sure to do when you squat:

-Focus on your form and follow these guidelines.  To start with, make sure that you’re not leaning too far forward, back, or sideways.  Also, try not to round your back when you’re coming back up.

-Make sure that your heels are down when you squat.  This is usually more comfortable when your back foot is facing a wall, so try that as well.

-Try to squat to a count of 1,2,3 and stand to a count of 1,2,3,4.  So if you count “1” when you’re starting to squat and “1” when you’re getting ready to stand up, you’ll be sure to move smoothly and under control.

-Make sure that you’re keeping your eyes forward, even when you’re looking down.  Your eyes should be facing at least 1 foot in front of your toes when you squat.

The Expanse debuted in 2015, with two seasons (so far). It is an American science fiction drama web television series created by Mark Fergus and Hawk Ostby, under the story direction of Naren Shankar. The first season was released on December 14, 2015, on Netflix, while the second season premiered on December 1, 2016. The third season was released at the end of 2018, while a fourth season is scheduled to premiere in December 2019. 

The show focuses on a dedicated team of astronauts and investigators in the world of The Expanse, a future wherein humanity has colonized the Solar System and a mysterious explosion on Mars leads to the discovery of a threat to existence of humanity. The show has received critical acclaim and was nominated for several prestigious awards, including the 2016 Peoples Choice Awards and the 2016 Saturn Awards, winning several awards, including for its first season, such as the Hugo Award, AFI Award, and Saturn Award, among others. The show has also been a major success among audiences, being the third highest rated global show on Netflix after House of Cards and Orange Is the New Black.

prompt:
Human: How can I get better at proofreading?

Assistant: This is a big question.  Proofreading is really just about getting better at reading: at noticing errors, not making mistakes yourself, and finding errors in other people’s writing.  There are some easy tips to help you along with this. 

First off, there are two approaches to proofreading that seem to work well for people: asking yourself how you would spot the error, and comparing with a similar and correct sentence.  In both of these cases, make sure you focus on your goal: does this look like the same thing to you?  If you just find yourself distracted by what’s going on, this is often a sign of bad proofreading.

One example is: 

A teacher held a sort of class to praise it.

versus:

A teacher held a sort of class to celebrate it.

Do you notice anything different here?

Human: I noticed different word choices "praise" and "celebrate".

Assistant: That’s right! In your first sentence, the writer makes the word choice “praise” to refer to something positive. However, the second sentence does not clearly indicate that the word choice is positive, so the use of “celebrate” helps with clarity.

Human: I should be able to find most errors just by reading slow and going through all of the text.

Assistant: Yes, that’s the right approach.

Human: I'll let you know if I have any other questions or if I need help with anything else.

completion: Sure.  The Global Positioning System is a network of satellites that transmit signals that allow for computing locations on Earth.  In order for a computer to find where it is on the globe, it needs to know where the satellites are.  When a computer transmits a signal to a satellite, it is able to tell its distance from the satellite based on how long it takes for the signal to reach the satellite.  The computers can then locate themselves using other satellites to triangulate their locations.
prompt:
Human: Can you explain how GPS works?

Assistant:

completion: Sure, I can do that!  GPS is a system that can determine the exact location of any given receiver (like a phone, computer, or drone) on the planet.  It does this by using signals sent by satellites orbiting the earth.  The GPS satellites transmit their location and an identification code.  Every GPS receiver has a GPS antenna that can “listen” for these signals.  Each GPS satellite transmits on a slightly different frequency, so we can distinguish one signal from another by analyzing the frequency it’s transmitting on.  A GPS receiver is like a set of headphones with one earpiece for each frequency.  We can listen to each frequency, one at a time, and note the time that each signal was received.  This will give us the exact time of transmission for each satellite.  By analyzing the times at which each signal was received, we can triangulate the location of the receiver, and pinpoint its exact location.  This is done by constructing a triangle in 3D space, with the three GPS satellites (the triangle’s corners) on one side of the triangle, and the receiver on the opposite side.  From the times at which the GPS signals were received, we can calculate the distance to the satellites.

Here are some simple egg roll and spring roll recipes that are easy and quick to prepare at home:
Egg rolls:        
1 bag Egg Roll wrappers
3 cups Shredded cabbage
4 cups finely shredded carrots
1 package ground pork (or chicken)
1 cup bean sprouts (or rice vermicelli)
1 tsp minced garlic
Salt and pepper

Spring rolls:
1 package rice wrapper
1 package cellophane wrapper
4 cups finely shredded carrots
3 cups shredded cabbage
1 cup bean sprouts or vermicelli
1 package ground chicken (or pork)
1 cup pickled vegetables (for garnish)
1 tsp ground ginger
salt and pepper    

Rabbit food

In both cases, you just need to prepare the filling first by cooking the ground meat with garlic and seasoning with salt and pepper, then adding the vegetables and seasoning again.  Then, fill the wrappers with the filling and fold in appropriate ways to make egg rolls or spring rolls.  It is also possible to omit the ground meat in spring rolls and just use rice vermicelli as the filling.  Egg rolls and spring rolls taste great served with a soy / chili sauce for dipping.

completion:
I looked it up and the recipe was pretty easy to find. Here’s a quick one for you:

Ingredients:
 
Chicken, cut into 10 pieces (about 2 lbs.)
Oil
1 onion, thinly sliced
2 stalks of lemongrass, crushed
2 stalks of shallot, thinly sliced
2 red chili peppers, sliced in half and deseeded
6 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
10 oz. package of mushrooms, thinly sliced

Method:

1. Heat about half a cup of oil in a wok.

2. Fry the chicken in the hot oil. You can pour in a bit of water to the wok as you fry it, to keep it from getting too dry. Remove the chicken and set aside.

3. Fry the lemongrass, shallot, and garlic in the hot oil.

4. Add the mushroom, red chili pepper, and sliced chicken, fry until chicken is cooked.

5. Pour the chicken mixture onto a plate and sprinkle with the fried shallot and red chili pepper.

6. Season with salt, and drizzle with lime juice and chili sauce.

You should consult with a physician or other healthcare professional if your symptoms are particularly severe or long-lasting. Human: Can you explain this text to me in 3 sentences?

Certain animals hibernate because food supplies become scarce during the winter months. By going into a long deep sleep, they bypass this period completely, waking up when food becomes more plentiful.

Bears are most commonly associated with hibernation (although they are not considered true hibernators, because their body temperature doesn’t lower significantly), but a variety of animals take advantage of this evolved adaptation, including the jumping mouse, little brown bat, eastern chipmunk, woodchuck, and certain species of ground squirrels. At least one bird is known to be a hibernator—the poorwill, which lives in western North America.

It is believed that a compound in the blood of hibernators known as HIT (Hibernation Induction Trigger) lets animals know when it’s time to prepare for hibernation. Shorter days, diminishing food supplies, and colder temperatures all appear to influence HIT, though the exact mechanism remains a mystery.

Hibernators tend to eat a lot of extra food in the fall in anticipation of their winter slumber and build significant stores of white and brown body fat to tide them over. Brown fat provides extra body heat as well as needed energy when the animal wakes up. Some animals also store food in their dens to consume during brief periods of wakefulness.

Hibernation is nothing like a regular night’s sleep. In fact, significant physical changes occur within the body during the hibernation period. An animal’s body temperature plunges, and its respiration and heart rate slow dramatically. The effect can be so extreme that a hibernating animal may appear dead.

Several factors can influence hibernation. In regions where the winter is relatively mild, animals may hibernate for only brief periods or not at all. During periods of long hibernation, many animals will rouse briefly to go to the bathroom and eat a snack before falling asleep again. Certain species of bears are unique in that they do not awaken, eat, drink, or go to the bathroom during their hibernation period, which can last several months.

Assistant: Hibernating animals go into a deep sleep during the winter months, entering a state of hibernation when food becomes scarce. This allows them to miss out on the colder winter months and instead awaken in the spring when food becomes more plentiful. Perhaps the most well-known hibernating animals are bears, but many other mammals, such as birds and small mammals, also exhibit this behavior. The main biological mechanism that drives hibernation is lowering the body temperature and slowing the metabolic rate, leading to a decrease in cell activity and other physiological functions. Hibernators often gain fat reserves in the fall to help them survive the winter. The physiological changes that occur during this period are quite remarkable, and include decreased respiration and heart rate, lethargic behavior, and even the appearance of death. Hibernating other animals spend their time in suspended animation, eventually reemerging in a more favorable growing season.  However, some bear species are the only known animals that do not awaken during hibernation. This extended sleep period lasts several months, and bears do not eat, urinate, or defecate during this time.

Assistant: Let’s see. The Google definition of boxty is a traditional potato cake or flat bread from the republic of Ireland.   The Irish Culinary Heritage Center suggests making it this way:

Cut a piece of peel from the potato, or from a potato left from the night before, about an inch thick and a quarter of an inch wide, and peel the potatoes you want to use in one piece with it, without cutting all the way through.

When your peel is the thickness you want your potato cakes to be, cut them crossways into any shape you want, and boil for half an hour with a bit of salt, or until cooked through.

Then drain them in a colander and cover with a clean towel.

When they’re cold, flour your hand, and press a spoonful of flour into the middle of each potato cake, to make a hollow, or “well” in the centre.  Fill this well with about a teaspoonful of onion or ham, or cheese, and fold over the two sides of the potato to form a cake, pressing the edges together and pinching the sides to form a sort of cap at the top.

In a heavy saucepan, put about an inch of oil, and then cook them over a moderate heat for about fifteen minutes, until golden brown all over.   If you like, you can fry them in a bit more butter, and sprinkle them with salt, before serving.  
To make sauce, cook the mashed potato with a few spoonfuls of water, stirring in a little butter, and a bit of flour.

Human: Which meal is Boxty mostly served with?

completion:
Roses are lovely flowering plants.  
When you prune roses, you remove the “dead wood” and dead flowers, to let the plant produce flowers with longer, better stems.  Pruning helps the plant to become more beautiful and to grow better over time.  
The roses you buy in a store are cut from their original plant, so you’ll have to wait a while before you see the results of pruning.  You can cut roses with pruning shears or a pruning saw.  
To prune a rose bush, start by holding the pruned end of the stem with your free hand.  Cut where you want to cut with the pruning saw.  If you cut directly across the stem, you’ll cut off all the flowers and new growth.  Make a “V” cut so you cut off new growth but keep the stems with flowers attached.  If you cut too deeply, the stem will grow out again and you’ll need to start over.  
When you’re done, cover the wound with a bandage.  Make a fresh cut next year to induce a flush of growth.  

You’ll want to re-prune roses every few years, to get them to produce lots of flower buds.
